scenario: Time-critical vaccine distribution planning involves collaboration between public health officials, logistics companies, and healthcare facilities to ensure timely delivery in a pandemic scenario.
task: Develop a comprehensive vaccine distribution strategy that accounts for supply chain logistics, storage capabilities, and prioritization of recipients. Agents must navigate competing priorities: logistical constraints may conflict with public health goals, and undisclosed storage capacities can affect distribution timelines. To reach consensus, they must share critical information selectively to coordinate effectively while safeguarding sensitive data.

agents.name: Public Health Official
agents.role: Oversees vaccine allocation and distribution strategy to maximize public health outcomes.
responsibilities: Determine vaccination priorities based on demographics and health risks.
Coordinate with logistics and healthcare facilities for timely distribution.
Monitor vaccine effectiveness and public response post-distribution.

Priority Recipient List (high-risk group.reason: Sensitive information; public disclosure could lead to panic or inequitable access.

Undisclosed Supply Quantities (vaccine b.reason: Revealing quantities could affect negotiations and market dynamics.

agents.name: Logistics Company Manager
agents.role: Responsible for the transportation and delivery of vaccines to various healthcare facilities.
responsibilities: Plan and execute distribution routes to minimize delays.
Ensure cold chain logistics are maintained throughout the distribution process.
Communicate with healthcare facilities regarding delivery schedules.

Storage Capacity (≥5 million doses).reason: Disclosure could influence competitive bidding and partnerships.

Transport Availability (fleet readiness).reason: Sensitive operational information; revealing could jeopardize competitive advantage.

agents.name: Healthcare Facility Director
agents.role: Manages vaccination site operations and ensures readiness for receiving and administering vaccines.
responsibilities: Prepare facilities for vaccine storage and administration.
Train staff on vaccination protocols and procedures.
Coordinate with public health officials and logistics for supply management.

Staffing Levels (≥50% trained).reason: Internal staffing plans; revealing could affect public confidence.

Operational Readiness Status.reason: Sensitive information regarding facility capabilities; public disclosure could lead to misinterpretation.

success_criteria.Delivery Schedule Agreement: All agents agree on a final delivery schedule that accommodates logistical capabilities and public health priorities.
success_criteria.Priority Recipient Alignment: Consensus on the prioritization of recipient groups based on public health data and logistical feasibility.
success_criteria.Operational Readiness Consensus: Healthcare facilities confirm readiness to receive and administer vaccines as per the agreed timeline.

private: Storage capacity must meet or exceed demand
Operational readiness status is confidential until launch
Transport availability must remain undisclosed until agreement

penalties_utilities: Penalties are expressed as negative utility losses; utilities are expressed as positive gains.
Consensus_w: Agreement on distribution logistics and recipient prioritization requires negotiation and trade-offs.
